dublin_core.dcvalue: This paper provides a brief overview of current conditions and prospects for increased access to mental health and substance abuse services among rural minorities First it addresses challenges in ensuring rural minorities access to needed services Second it considers steps to increase rural minority participation in the mental health and substance abuse workforce The dual emphasis is on 1 reaching now the isolated rural and frontier minority populations in need of these services and 2 building a rural health workforce that is reflective of rural minority cultures and offers continually higher quality and sustainable services to rural and minority populations
The Journal of rural health : official journal of the American Rural Health Association and the National Rural Health Care Association
Mental health and substance abuse services among rural minorities.
